page.title: 18Housing Summary.
page.content: Escrick has 5 main types of houses.{ {Estate houses}were largely built before 1915:originally 48 houses,and 4 more in 1948/49.Now 33 houses belong to the Estate,the rest having been sold for private dwellings.All Estate farmhouses are rented from the Estate. Workers from the Estate occupy the houses,and widows and retired workers remain in the houses,rent free,for as long as they wish.These Estate houses are either terraced or semi-detached, most of them built with brick and slate roofs with the occasional pantiled roof.{Council houses}were built on land purchased from the Estate in 1951. 8 semi-detached houses were built along the Skipwith Road and a further 4 were built in 1956.Several of these properties have been sold to tenants for private dwellings.
